import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"List funding sources (legacy)"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/funding-sources/query"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Retrieves a paginated list of funding sources using query parameters only. This legacy GET is helpful for simple paging, but it does not support the richer filter body available in the POST version.

**Prerequisites**
1. None.

**Workflow Example**
1. Call [GET /api/v1.0/funding-sources/query](/docs/api/funding-sources/get-funding-sources-legacy) with `$top`, `$skip`, and optional sort fields.
2. If you need advanced filters, switch to [POST /api/v1.0/funding-sources/query](/docs/api/funding-sources/search-funding-sources) and reuse the IDs returned in `Items[].FundingSourceId`.
3. Fetch full details with [GET /api/v1.0/funding-sources/\{FundingSourceId\}](/docs/api/funding-sources/get-funding-source-by-id) when preparing to update or delete.

**Minimal Required Fields**: None.

**Deprecated**: Use [POST /api/v1.0/funding-sources/query](/docs/api/funding-sources/search-funding-sources) instead for complex filtering.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"$top","in":"query","description":"Maximum number of records to return (page size)","schema":{"type":"integer","default":25}},{"name":"$skip","in":"query","description":"Number of records to skip for pagination","schema":{"type":"integer","default":0}},{"name":"$orderby","in":"query","description":"Field name to sort by","schema":{"type":"string"}},{"name":"$orderbyDirection","in":"query","description":"Sort direction","schema":{"type":"string","enum":["asc","desc"]}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
